 014: 
 015: 
 016: """
 017: *  Description:
 018: *     This function contracts (erodes) or expands (dilates) the pixels
 019: *     which are marked as "on" in the supplied input array using a cellular
 020: *     automata, and returns the result in an output array of the same shape
 021: *     and size as the input array.
 022: *
 023: *     Each output pixel value is created in turn as follows: If the
 024: *     corresponding input value has value equal to or greater than "magic",
 025: *     then the output pixel is set equal to "magic". Otherwise, a
 026: *     3x3x3 cube (or a 3x3 square for 2D arrays) is defined within the input
 027: *     array which is centred on the position of the current output pixel. The
 028: *     fraction of pixels within this input cube which are flagged as "on" is
 029: *     then counted. If this fraction is larger than "thresh" then the output
 030: *     pixel value is set to "on", otherwise it is set to "off". Optionally,
 031: *     an additional requirement for an output pixel to be set on is that
 032: *     the corresponding input pixel must be on.
 033: """
 034:

+132: def remove_isolate(inp, frac, on, off, centre):
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_6acalib_6clumps_6ca_old_1remove_isolate(PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds); /*proto*/

  PyObject *__pyx_v_frac = 0;

  PyObject *__pyx_v_off = 0;
